intro: Coccoloba longependula, commonly known as the coral tree or red mangrove, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, which are typically green with a waxy surface. It thrives in coastal areas and can tolerate saline conditions, making it adaptable to mangrove environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in tropical ecosystems.
